newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Coelba shares auctioned for 28.5 mln reais.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Coelba shares auctioned for 28.5 mln reais.

text.p: A block of 550 million voting shares in Bahia state power firm Companhia de Eletricidade da Bahia (Coelba) has been sold for 28.55 million reais ($27.72 million) on the Rio de Janeiro stock exchange.
The shares were being sold at auction by BNDESpar, the investment arm of Brazil's National Development Bank (BNDES), at a minimum price of 27.5 million reais ($26.7 million).
The share block represents 5.8 percent of Coelba's voting capital and 5.2 percent of total capital.
This is the first block of shares to be sold by BNDESpar, which acquired 135 million reais ($131.1 million) worth of debentures convertible into Coelba shares earlier this year.
The proceeds of that transaction went towards restructuring Coelba ahead of its privatization in the first half of 1998.
Investment banks Bozano Simonsen, Cindam, Fonte and Pactual and brokerage firm Maxima took part in the auction.
-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151
